description: Rada Miskovic publishes an impassioned editorial, openly demanding a Truth Tribunal and calling for citizens to testify about BCI injustices.
Under mounting public and internal pressure after Rada's editorial, the Council votes to authorize a public Truth Tribunal. Rada is appointed to moderate the opening sessions.
The Council officially announces a citywide Truth Tribunal. Citizens are invited to submit testimony about BCI harms and abuses. Rada encourages broad participation through nightly segments.
Testimonies at the Tribunal reveal extensive BCI-driven discrimination and resource deprivation. Emotional accounts intensify calls for justice as new systemic flaws are exposed.

Shortly after explosive testimony implicates Directorate members, a massive blackout corrupts Tribunal archives and forces its suspension. Public anger surges, and the city is left divided with no resolution.
